ננו-סיבים עמילניים מנפצים את השיא של הפסטה הדקה בעולם https://www.sciencenews.org/article/thinnest-pasta-nanofibersSkyler Ware Tue, 03 Dec 2024 16:00:00 +0000Materials Science https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3146797 The fibers, made from white flour and formic acid, average just 372 nanometers in diameter and might find use in biodegradable bandages. 3146797
הזאבים האתיופיים הם הטורפים הגדולים הראשונים שנמצאו בולעים צוף https://www.sciencenews.org/article/ethiopia-wolves-carnivore-nectar-pollenErin Garcia de Jesús Tue, 03 Dec 2024 14:00:00 +0000Animals https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3146698 Wolves from three different packs were seen licking red hot poker flowers. קריסת קרח בלתי צפויה מרמזת על שינויים מדאיגים בחוף האנטארקטי https://www.sciencenews.org/article/unexpected-ice-collapse-antarctic-coastDouglas Fox Tue, 03 Dec 2024 10:00:00 +0000Climate https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3146867 The Conger Ice Shelf disintegrated in 2022. ייתכן שהניאנדרטלים בנו אח במיוחד להכנת זפת https://www.sciencenews.org/article/neandertals-hearth-used-to-make-tarRichard Kemeny Mon, 02 Dec 2024 18:00:00 +0000Archaeology https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3146703 Findings from a cave in Gibraltar suggests Neandertals may have used complex fire structures to obtain adhesives from plants. 3146703

הקוראים שואלים על בהונות עטלף זוהרות ועל ריקבון חלקיקים נדיר https://www.sciencenews.org/article/readers-glowing-bat-toes-particle-decayScience News Staff Sat, 30 Nov 2024 12:00:00 +0000Uncategorized https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3146674 Toe-tally mysterious Hairs on the toes of Mexican free-tailed bats light up under ultraviolet light, but the reason is unknown, Jason Bittel reported in “Mexican free-tailed bats’ toes glow in the dark” (SN: 8/28/24). Reader Eleanor Peterson asked if the glowing toes might attract prey. It is unlikely, but it is a logical thought, says […] 3146674
